name: Pricing
description: Pricing across these episodes is treated as a core product strategy (not a finance afterthought): how you package value, set willingness-to-pay anchors, and choose a monetization model that matches your product’s value delivery and go-to-market motion. The theme covers how pricing evolves with maturity (PLG → PLS/enterprise), how to avoid early pricing traps (especially in AI), and how to use experimentation and research to improve retention, expansion, and long-term profitability.
subtopics: Designing pricing from day one: avoiding early anchors that cap willingness-to-pay and constrain future expansion
Choosing the right pricing model (seat-based, usage-based, tiered/freemium, hybrid, outcome-based) based on value metric, attribution, and customer maturity
Packaging and paywalls: defining free vs paid boundaries, feature gating, and when to shift from self-serve to product-led sales
Pricing as an ongoing product loop: research, segmentation, experimentation, and iteration rather than “set and forget”
Monetization + retention linkage: connecting users to core value, reducing churn, and driving expansion through better value realization
Enterprise pricing dynamics: differentiation, discount discipline, and structuring deals around value/outcomes instead of commoditized feature checklists
common_frameworks: Market share vs wallet share (acquisition vs monetization/expansion) as a paired strategy
Willingness-to-pay anchoring and price architecture set early to preserve future pricing power
Value metric selection (pricing aligned to the unit of value delivered: seats, usage, outcomes, etc.)
Outcome-based pricing decision criteria (high autonomy + clear attribution + measurable outcomes)
PLG → PLS progression (self-serve monetization limits leading to product-owned pipeline creation and sales collaboration)
Freemium boundary design (what must be free to drive adoption vs what must be paid to protect revenue and signal value)
Continuous pricing iteration loop (qualitative research + segmentation + controlled experiments + rollout/guardrails)
